intro: Cryptolappa sericea, commonly known as the silky cryptolappa, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
